000: In {country}, there is no legal framework for ASP, no unified social registry, and support was not promptly provided during recent disasters. Overall, adaptive social protection mechanisms are largely absent, leaving vulnerable populations exposed.
001: In {country}, support was provided during recent disasters, but there is no legal framework or unified social registry. Relief reaches people in practice, but systemic coverage and institutional foundations are weak.
010: In {country}, a unified social registry exists, but there is no legal framework and support during recent disasters was not promptly provided. Targeting capacity exists, yet institutional authority and operational responsiveness are limited.
011: In {country}, a social registry is in place and support was provided during recent disasters, but no legal framework defines ASP roles. Operational mechanisms function, but formal institutional authority is lacking.
100: In {country}, a legal framework defines ASP roles, but there is no social registry and support was not promptly delivered during disasters. Institutional authority exists, but targeting capacity and operational responsiveness are weak.
101: In {country}, ASP roles are legally defined and support was provided during recent disasters, but there is no unified social registry. Legal authority exists and relief reaches people, yet targeting and systematic implementation remain limited.
110: In {country}, a legal framework exists and a unified social registry is in place, but support was not promptly delivered during disasters. ASP is institutionally and technically structured, yet operational responsiveness needs improvement.
111: In {country}, a comprehensive adaptive social protection system is in place: legal framework, unified social registry, and timely support during disasters. Vulnerable populations are systematically targeted and assisted through well-coordinated ASP mechanisms.
